text.p: The following are the reports carried by Estonia's newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- An Estonian fishing ship sank near the island of Osmussaar late on Thursday, one member of the three-man crew is still missing.
- Tallinn municipality will refer to the police 72 allegedly improper privatisation cases of central city apartments.
- The opposition estimates that the new cabinet will last until autumn at least but it will mainly depend on the cabinet's own performance.
- British Defence Minister Michael Portillo expressed support to Estonia during a meeting with Estonian counterpart Andrus Oovel. Portillo is to visit Estonia in the near future.
- Estonia has appointed charges a d'affaires to Dublin and Athens. Another will soon be appointed to Beijing.
- Prime minister designate Mart Siimann will probably change the agriculture and regional affairs ministers. New candidates have not yet been announced.
- An anonymous citizen returned to the National Art Museum two water-colours from among 141 stolen from the museum during 1995.
